A Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape is a type of and a type of . A Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape is the shape in three orthogonal dimensions of a keepout constraint for a .
Keepout regions typically include some minimal spacing around the extreme shape.
the shape_extent specifies the for the Physical_unit_3d_keepout_shape as extrusion, manhattan_block, other, or is_unknown.

A Physical_unit_3d_shape is a type of and a type of . A Physical_unit_3d_shape is the shape in three orthogonal dimensions of a . A Physical_unit_3d_shape may be included for purposes which include the actual shape or boundaries of the actual shape. A shall not be referenced by a Physical_unit_3d_shape.
When a extreme boundary of the actual shape is provided, mass property calculations based on the extreme shape may be invalid, depending on the purpose. For example, the centroid_location in particular may not be valid for an extreme shape representing the envelope of a mult-mode vibration since the centroid may also vary over a range.
The shape for a is provided by a , eliminating the requirement to support a shape for a separately.
the shape_purpose specifies the as a predefined_3d_purpose or an external_definition.
